1.name: A Day at the Races
1.description: A veterinarian posing as a doctor and a race-horse owner and his friends struggle to help keep a sanitarium open with the help of a misfit race-horse.

2.name: Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs
2.description: Exiled into the dangerous forest by her wicked stepmother, a princess is rescued by seven dwarf miners who make her part of their household.

3.name: A Star Is Born
3.description: A young woman comes to Hollywood with dreams of stardom, but achieves them only with the help of an alcoholic leading man whose best days are behind him.

4.name: Shall We Dance
4.description: A budding romance between a ballet master and a tap dancer becomes complicated when rumors surface that they're already married.

5.name: The Case of the Stuttering Bishop
5.description: An improbable stuttering bishop from Australia asks for Perry's help in proving the identity of the legitimate heir to a millionaire.

6.name: Confession
6.description: Aging down on her luck cabaret singer murders a respectable composer. On trial she slowly gives in and explains her crime. They had a complicated history.

7.name: Lost Horizon
7.description: A plane crash delivers a group of people to the secluded land of Shangri-La - but is it the miraculous utopia it appears to be?

8.name: Public Wedding
8.description: The operators of a bankrupt carnival sideshow hope to restore their fallen fortunes by staging a fake 'public wedding' in the mouth of their unprofitable giant whale. But the intended '...                See full summary »

9.name: Conquest
9.description: A Polish countess becomes Napoleon Bonaparte's mistress at the urging of Polish leaders, who feel she could influence him to make Poland independent.

10.name: The Awful Truth
10.description: Unfounded suspicions lead a married couple to begin divorce proceedings, whereupon they start undermining each other's attempts to find new romance.

11.name: La Grande Illusion
11.description: During the First World War, two French soldiers are captured and imprisoned in a German P.O.W. camp. Several escape attempts follow until they are sent to a seemingly impenetrable fortress which seems impossible to escape from.

12.name: Way Out West
12.description: Stanley and Ollie are enlisted to deliver the deed to a goldmine in a small village, only for it to be stolen.

13.name: Stage Door
13.description: A chronicle of the ambitions, dreams, and disappointments of aspiring actresses who all live in the same boarding house.

14.name: The Good Earth
14.description: Although married Chinese farmers Wang and O-Lan initially experience success, their lives are complicated by declining fortunes and lean times, as well as the arrival of the beautiful young Lotus.

15.name: Big City
15.description: To avoid a taxi war, city officials blame a gang bombing on driver Joe Benton's wife Anna and put her on a ship to deport her. The mayor is speaker at a boxers' banquet where Joe pleads for...                See full summary »

16.name: Topper
16.description: A fun-loving couple, finding that they died and are now ghosts, decide to shake up the stuffy lifestyle of a friend of theirs.

17.name: Captains Courageous
17.description: A spoiled brat who falls overboard from a steamship gets picked up by a fishing boat, where he's made to earn his keep by joining the crew in their work.

18.name: Smart Blonde
18.description: Female reporter Torchy Blane teams with her cop boyfriend Lt. Steve McBride to solve the killing of an investor who just bought a popular local nightclub.

19.name: Heidi
19.description: A plucky little orphan girl gets dumped abruptly into her gruff, hermit grandfather's care, then later gets retaken and delivered as a companion for an injured girl.

20.name: They Gave Him a Gun
20.description: Jimmy is drafted and ends up in Fred's troop on his way to Europe. Jimmy becomes vicious with his gun, wins a medal, and weds Fred's nurse girlfriend, Rose. Back home years later, Rose ...                See full summary »

21.name: Make Way for Tomorrow
21.description: An elderly couple are forced to separate when they lose their house and none of their five children will take both parents in.

22.name: You Only Live Once
22.description: The public defender's secretary and an ex-convict get married and try to make a life together, but a series of disasters sends their lives spiraling out of control.

23.name: Dead End
23.description: The lives of a young man and woman, an infamous gangster and a group of street kids converge one day in a volatile New York City slum.

24.name: Nothing Sacred
24.description: An eccentric woman learns she is not dying of radium poisoning as earlier assumed, but when she meets a reporter looking for a story, she feigns sickness again for her own profit.

25.name: Saratoga
25.description: After winning a stud farm in lieu of gambling debts, bookie Duke Bradley turns an eye to the daughter of the now deceased gambler and her millionaire fiancée.

26.name: Stella Dallas
26.description: A working-class woman is willing to do whatever it takes to give her daughter a socially promising future.

27.name: The Life of Emile Zola
27.description: The biopic of the famous French muckraking writer and his involvement in fighting the injustice of the Dreyfuss Affair.

28.name: Young and Innocent
28.description: A man on the run from a murder charge enlists a beautiful stranger who must put herself at risk for his cause.

29.name: Marked Woman
29.description: A crusading DA persuades a clip joint "party girl" to testify against her mobster boss after her innocent sister is accidentally murdered during one of his unsavory "parties".

30.name: The Prisoner of Zenda
30.description: An Englishman on a Ruritarian holiday must impersonate the king when the rightful monarch, a distant cousin, is drugged and kidnapped.

31.name: They Won't Forget
31.description: A politically ambitious district attorney, unscrupulous tabloid journalists, and regional prejudice combine to charge a teacher with the murder of his student.

32.name: Wee Willie Winkie
32.description: Priscilla Williams, a young girl living with her widowed mother and paternal grandfather at the post he commands in northern India, becomes enamored of military life and embroiled in brewing rebellion against the crown in the early 1900's.

33.name: Night Must Fall
33.description: When a rich but cantankerous dowager on an isolated estates hires an engaging handyman, her niece/companion becomes suspicious of his motives.

34.name: The Hurricane
34.description: A Polynesian sailor -- unjustly imprisoned after defending himself against a colonial bully -- is relentlessly persecuted by his island's martinet French governor.

35.name: Double Wedding
35.description: Two sisters of differing temperaments, the younger's milquetoast fiancé, and a free-spirited artist in an auto trailer are all experiencing romantic complications.

36.name: The Prince and the Pauper
36.description: A poor boy named Tom Canty and the Prince of Wales exchange identities but events force the pair to experience each other's lives as well.

37.name: King Solomon's Mines
37.description: White hunter Allan Quartermain and his enigmatic guide help a young Irish woman locate her missing father in unexplored Darkest Africa.

38.name: Stand-In
38.description: A New York bank plans to sell a Hollywood studio at a big loss. But the head accountant is suspicious and goes to investigate. He finds chicanery, romance, and help to save the studio.

39.name: Fire Over England
39.description: Queen Elizabeth is running this show. The men in her court should be thinking about how to add to the glory of the Elizabethan Age and how to foil those pesky Spanish who got far too much ...                See full summary »

40.name: Breakfast for Two
40.description: Texan debutante Valentine Ransome tries to reform a bankrupt playboy.

41.name: Easy Living
41.description: During the Great Depression, a wealthy banker throws away his wife's expensive fur coat; it lands on the head of a stenographer, leading to everyone assuming she is his mistress and has access to his millions.

42.name: Elephant Boy
42.description: This black and white movie is based on Rudyard Kipling's "Toomai, of the Elephants", in which a small native lad claims he knows the congregating place of the elephant hordes.

43.name: History Is Made at Night
43.description: A wealthy divorcée falls for a charming Parisian, but her insanely jealous ex-husband will do anything to get her back.

44.name: Kid Galahad
44.description: Fight promoter Nick Donati grooms a bellhop as a future champ, but has second thoughts when the 'kid' falls for his sister.

45.name: Dark Journey
45.description: During World War I, a German spy and a French spy meet and fall in love.

46.name: The Edge of the World
46.description: A way of life is dying on an Outer Hebridean island fishing port, but some of the inhabitants resist evacuating to the mainland.

47.name: The Adventurous Blonde
47.description: After rival reporters, jealous of Torchy's success, conspire to fake the murder of an actor in order to embarrass her, he ends up being strangled.

48.name: Oh, Mr. Porter!
48.description: With the help of a relative, a hopeless railway employee is made stationmaster of Buggleskelly. Determined to make his mark, he devises a number of schemes to put Buggleskelly on the railway map, but instead falls foul of a gang of gun runners.

49.name: Law for Tombstone
49.description: A stagecoach line hires an agent to stop a string of robberies of gold shipments.

50.name: Think Fast, Mr. Moto
50.description: On a freighter going from San Francisco to Shanghai Mr. Moto solves mysteries caused by a gang of smugglers.
